properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of heavy rain is forecast for the central coast of British Columbia for Thursday and Friday. A couple of frontal waves will make landfall on the central coast of British Columbia on Thursday and Friday. The total rainfall amount from the two sets of frontal waves is forecast to be near 100 mm. The forecast heavy rain on top of antecedent moisture may result in localised flooding or road washouts. Environment and Climate Change Canada meteorologists will continue to refine the forecasts. Rainfall warnings may be issued as the event draws closer. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T04:39:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T12:40:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1062663776.2020
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections, Central Coast - inland sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain possible tonight and Thursday morning. Patchy freezing drizzle is forecast through this evening followed by a risk of freezing rain beginning near midnight or early Thursday morning. If freezing rain does develop, ice accumulations may be up to 2 millimeters in some locales. Freezing rain will come to an end on Thursday morning. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T10:28:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T18:29:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0539573534.2020
Area: Kirkland Lake - Englehart, Temiskaming Shores - Temagami, North Bay - Powassan - Mattawa
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning into the afternoon. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 centimetres are expected with the heaviest snow falling this morning. The snow is forecast to end early this afternoon. Travel is expected to be impacted due to moderate to heavy snow. Motorists should be prepared for winter weather driving conditions. A risk of freezing drizzle will follow the snow into this evening, predominantly for locations in the vicinity of the Ottawa River. This freezing precipitation may make roads slippery overnight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T05:29:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T13:30:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3007067325.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system will bring a mix of rain and snow to Southern Quebec overnight tonight. During the changeover from snow to rain, an area of freezing rain may be possible early Thursday morning. Freezing precipitation could make roads slippery Thursday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T12:51:02-00:00

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intensifying low pressure system over northern Hudson Bay will lead to strong northeasterly winds over Coral Harbour beginning Thursday afternoon. The strong winds, with gusts up to 80 km/h, combined with fresh and falling snow, will lead to blizzard or near blizzard conditions that will persist into Friday before easing through the day. This winter storm watch may be upgraded to a blizzard warning as the event nears and conditions are monitored. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T12:32:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T20:33:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0415906492.2020
Area: Coral Harbour

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing precipitation accumulations of 2 millimetres are expected over these areas. The freezing rain is expected to begin overnight tonight and end Thursday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected, with gusts near 100 km/h. Wind speeds will continue to increase throughout the day then weaken Thursday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T10:12:06-00:00

properties.Title: Test - This Is A Scheduled Test Of The Yukon Emergency Alerting System
properties.Summary:
Description: This is a TEST of the Yukon Emergency Alerting System, issued by Yukon EMO. If this had been an actual emergency, you would hear instructions that would assist you to protect you and your family. Visit www.yukon.ca and stay tuned to local media. This is ONLY a TEST.

properties.Author: Yukon Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A low moving across the Yukon will spread heavy snow to Dawson and southern sections of the Dempster beginning tonight and continuing through Thursday. Gusty winds near the Richardson Mountains will also lead to local blowing snow over the Dempster overnight and Thursday. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T03:38:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T11:39:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0627562220.2020
Area: Dawson, Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Areas of dense fog have developed overnight through Bulkley Valley and the Lakes District. Fog will clear this morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-25T22:50:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T12:59:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1684268668.2020
Area: Bulkley Valley, Lakes District

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Areas of dense fog will continue into this evening. Visibilities will improve somewhat as rain develops late this afternoon and into the evening. Patchy dense fog may redevelop in some locations tonight. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A cold front that moved through Qikiqtarjuaq this morning is giving strong north to northwest winds of 60 gusting to 80 km/h along with snow, blowing snow, and blizzard conditions. The blizzard will continue through the morning, with conditions starting to improve in the afternoon. During the worst of the blizzard, visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected in the area. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T01:59:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T15:18:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4237837818.2020
Area: Qikiqtarjuaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Advisory Alert Update - Civil Emergency
properties.Summary:
Description: This emergency advisory alert is being issued for the province of Saskatchewan. All travelers returning from outside of Canada are subject to a mandatory 14 day self isolation order. Violation of the order may result in a fine of 2000 dollars.
